social_posts.post_text:
functional 🜃 art
. 
I’ve been digging in clay. I was seeking a creative outlet away from my studio space and ceramics is what really held my heart. For me, every piece embraces imperfections, and each wobble, asymmetry, indent, and other handmade quality is intentionally preserved to bring hand built energy into the creative space. 

Seeing earth formed by hand reminds me to celebrate my handmade process of creating art while I'm using a functional piece of art.

No two pieces are alike. ♥
.
.
.
#handmadeceramics #ceramicpalette #ceramics

Birds. I want to paint birds. I want to experiment with their styles and colors and see what happens. I have avoided birds cuz in my mind I won’t do them “right” or do then “well” but honestly my favorite art is wonky and interpretive. So I’m gonna start to play and see how these babes develop. Do you all have a subject that you really want to master? Anything you’ve been wanting to dive into?
.
.
.
.
#sketchbook #sketchbooktour #sketchbookbootcamp #thepigeonletters #quail #birdart #sketchdaily

💡 Way more giftable than you might have thought 👉 Did you know that The Pigeon Letters donates a portion of every sale to the preservation and rehabilitation of wildlife? Giving back is an essential part of our business practices. It's a standard we consider to be a no-brainer. We believe that if we can make one positive impact a day, just one, that we've succeeded. Your continued support makes it possible to give back by contributing to nonprofits all over the globe who are working to better our earth. Together, we are supporting nonprofits working to save wildlife and rehabilitate injured and abandoned animals. Each month, a different organization is chosen. We're proud to say that together, we've provided support for so many wonderful organizations. More info at thepigeonletters.com/about 🥰
.
.
.
#shopsmall #shopsmallbusiness #giveback #wildlifepreservation #wildliferehab #wildliferefuge #animalrescue #supportwildlife #thepigeonletters

I’m BEYOND EXCITED to announce that I have partnered with Let’s Make Art to offer you something special. Introducing…  the Botanical Watercolor Crash Course  - covering everything you need to know to master botanical watercolor. It’s time to get messy, explore and let go of expectations.

✔️  5 classes: Learn to paint floral bouquets, wildflower meadows and lush greenery
✔️  Techniques for all levels: Practice watercolor and learn new techniques
✔️  ALL Supplies: INCLUDED - $128 value alone is more than the whole course ($100)!
✔️  Complete 5 new watercolor projects by the end of the course
✔️  Full step-by-step walk through video instructions to follow along
 
It’s time to play, explore and embrace imperfections 👩‍🎨 LINK: https://bit.ly/PeggyLMA (also in bio!)

#learnwatercolor #watercolorcourse #letsmakeart #thepigeonletters #watercolor

This is difficult to share but maybe it will help someone else not feel so alone in complicated feelings. 
#normalizegrief 🥀 Putting it bluntly, I don’t like December. It’s dark, it’s cold, and it’s when my mom died (and one of my dogs last yr). Today is the day she died… the exact time of winter solstice 3 years ago. I feel angry today and my heart feels just as cold as it is outside. I know anger is secondary, often to sadness. When I was growing up I wasn’t angry. I was annoyed and detached. Being annoyed was secondary to being scared and being detached was a coping skill I began developing at 4yo. I watched my hero suffer every single day of her life. Watching her optimistic spirit as she fought with the prison her body held her in.. she normalized suffering. She taught me resilience through observation. She showed me strength that can’t be defined. I watched her smile and laugh and push when she could have given up. Sometimes I wonder if I gave up. I never realized how much I’d deeply regret all the excuses I made not to visit her when I could have. I was selfish bc I was protective over what I didn’t understand. In a few ways, I’m still that 4yo child who learned about mom’s MS diagnosis. And I’m 5 & 6 & 7 and I see her walking with a cane and how proactive she is. I’m 8 and see her fall and injure herself and get double arm canes when one wouldn’t cut it anymore. I’m 9 and see a walker come home with her. I’m 10 & 11 and watch her on an electric scooter. I’m 12 and start recognizing deep emotions she fought with daily. I’m 13 and hear her get more frustrated with her body when it wouldn’t work. That was hard to witness. I’m 14 and hold my breath with angst, waiting to see what would unfold, be it through an emotional or physical crash and burn.  I’m a child who started grieving mom at the same time I’m learning to function. I’m stuck there. I miss my mom. There is no silver lining. Grief is grief. I’m sharing because we should be able to miss the people we’ve lost without fear of discomfort.
.
If you’ve lost someone, please say their name.

Kellie Jean 💔 My heart hurts in today’s December.

.

Art prompted by Drawing on Grief by @suttonkate 🖤

Over 3 days, I’ll provide you with the tools you need to know within Procreate so you can create a better workflow, optimize your potential within the program, and most of all, enjoy the discovery.
👉 freeprocreateclass.com 👈
.

Here’s what we’ll cover.

DAY 1: INTERFACE
👉 Learn shortcuts and gestures to speed up your workflow
👉 Discover the tricks about Procreate that otherwise take a long time to stumble upon
👉 Equip your quick menu + customized settings

DAY 2: LAYERS, BLEND MODES & MASKS
👉 Learn why and how working in layers will help your workflow
👉 Demystify all things masking and how it will ensure you work indestructibly

DAY 3: ALL THINGS BRUSHES
👉 Jump into brush adjustments to render the exact results you desire
👉 Get my favorite custom brushes FREE!
👉 Discover brush hacks that will increase productivity

And as if that wasn’t good enough, I’VE GOT DOWNLOADS FOR YOU

• brush pack of my custom go-to Procreate brushes that I use in my own digital work
• full guide of 70 Procreate gestures
• complete guide on all things Procreate brushes
• blend modes cheat sheet
.
Link is in bio or head to freeprocreateclass.com .
.
.
.
.
.

I was looking through my photos and it’s just so strange that we are a dogless household now. Sweet Billie would hang out with me under my desk and follow me from room to room, even if I only got up to go to the bathroom. Now my cats do it 😂 and I know is because of Billie. She raised them to be the best dog-cats they could be. They even beg and stare at anyone in the kitchen. Anybody else have dog-cats?
.

RIP Billie the Wonder Dog & Lucy Miss Lion Angel Baby

.
.

Ok so I launched my free challenge (Nobody Cares About Your Course) and the MAIN issue so many ppl are facing is: how to gain traction and get your online course SEEN - so I figured I should share this answer with everyone. Cuz obvi my #1 mission = to help you achieve WITHOUT overwhelm. 😅 

But I also am here to help you truly understand the real reason WHY you actually care about providing educational content and the bigger impact that will have on your life overall. 

It’s not just about the passive income you’ll make or the scale your business will see or the opportunities beyond educating, it’s about the overall, long term results that will forever change your life.

✨ So here’s what you need to know:

In order to set yourself up for long-term consistent results, you first need to reframe what you THINK you SHOULD do.

👉  You MUST give people something relatable that they'll actually care about, aside from what already inundates all of us online.

👉  You must give your students permission to explore and apply their creativity through your highly immersive experience WHILE you guide them

👉  Most importantly, you MUST create your own unique system that will allow your students to achieve far beyond what they’ve been able to with any other online curriculums.

Now off the top of your creative, brilliant mind,, how are you going to take action toward one of these bullet points? Like now? 👇
.
If you haven’t joined the free challenge yet, it comes with a bonus 50-page workbook. Yes I’m serious. https://thepigeonletters.com/7daychallenge
.
.
.
.
#creativecourselab #coursecreators #coursecreation #coursecreationcoach #coursecreator #onlinecoach #teachonline #skillsharetopteacher #topteacher #thepigeonletters #peggydean

YOUR ANSWER, PLS! 👇
Content lives all over the Internet. It’s not special. It’s not new. That means that people are coming your way because of what makes you YOU as a human. What YOU are relaying within the unique way that only YOU can relay it. This has and always will stand true: If somebody invests in you and shows up for you, it means that they find something about you to be meaningful to them. And it might be that you have a demeanor that makes them feel safe. They might be energized by you, or they might understand the way that you articulate things. Maybe they admire your creative style or how you carry yourself. They choose to invest in you because they trust YOU. 

If you called your closest friend right now and asked them to answer this question with only 3 words: “How do I share information?” What would they say? I dare you to do it and share their answer. 👇

#peptalk #coursecreation #creativecourselab #coursecreators #onlineteacher #peggydean #thepigeonletters

There are 2 reasons your course could be falling short. 👇

1️⃣ STRUCTURE - The first is quite possibly the lack of infused magic WITHIN your lessons. What does this mean exactly? It’s the way you position your messaging and engagement. Why should someone care about your content if you don’t give them a reason to? 

If the problem is your messaging, it means that you’re not clearly communicating how to engage with your content. 

2️⃣ MARKETING - The second reason could be a marketing issue. It goes a bit hand-in-hand with messaging. If you don’t position your offer in a way that your target students can easily identify, you won’t have a way to solve their problems or feed their interests. 

✨ Out of both of these, which one is more of a challenge for you? Your course structure, or your marketing? Leave a 1️⃣ or a 2️⃣ in the comments so I know which one I can help you with the most. ✨

I’ll be deep diving into both of these and a lot more in Creative Course Lab, of course. 

Because honestly 👉 magnetic engagement, explosive enrollments, and massive loyal retention is possible with both of these.

[The link to join the free training and to snag your workbook is in my bio, fyi!] 😘

.
.
.
#creativecourselab #entrepreneurship #coursecreator #coursecreation #marketingstrategy #thepigeonletters #peggydean

My heart is the happiest when I see life changing student success. This video made me so happy, I had to share:
・・・
“CCLab was THE BEST decision I made for my business! 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
In the fall of 2021, I began Peggy Dean’s Creative Course Lab {CCLab if you’re in the know}, which launched me into hyperdrive to learn the best solutions for creating an online course. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I followed along with each session as they dropped and filled up my notebook. The community of friends I gained can’t be beat! We encourage each other regularly still. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I took all the tools I had acquired and, in 2022, launched 3 new classes on Skillshare. With each new course, I print out new pages and fill them up! 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
My CCLab notebook is my go-to when I’m ready to begin a new course.  Peggy has given me the skills to create engaging classes and the marketing know-how to really be seen. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Peggy has recently launched open enrollment to Creative Course Lab again. If you’re thinking, this might be for you,  I can’t tell you enough to just do it!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
If you need to see for yourself, join her FREE 7-DAY CHALLENGE!
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Make yourself and your business a top priority. I’ve made back what I spent on this course, and then some! So if you can make it work... find a way.”
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀: reposted @perchhandmade 
#creativecourselab #coursecreation #teachonline #marketingtips #brainstorm #coursecreator #coursecreationcoach #coursecreationlab #thepigeonletters #peggydean #onlineteaching #teachonline #topteacher  #marketingstrategies #onlineclasses

I used to feel like this needed to be a secret. But we need to diversify our efforts and honestly, teaching has been incredibly rewarding on so many levels. Teaching online is the #1 way I grew my business. The kicker is that I started off by breaking rules. I didn’t like traditional methods so I forged my own path. Sure, it presented a ton of trial and error, but I persisted and did it my way anyway. Even through the struggle, I surpassed 6 figures simply teaching in only my first year.

So let’s get into it… The three things that got me consistent, passive 5-figure months AND landed me on The Today Show & The Wall Street Journal for my unique approach to online learning:

👉 Instead of regurgitating the "script" that online educators follow, I created my OWN transformational, comprehensive framework for creating engaging, profitable online classes.

👉 I figured out how to build immersive, engaging content that exceeds the demands of tomorrow's digital learners. 

👉 I took action instead of attempting perfection. I figured out exactly what I needed in order to produce DIY quality that converts and retains students.

I know it might seem like you will never get to where you want to be but I am CERTAIN that Creative Course Lab will get you to that next level. Let’s start with defining your signature framework inside your course. 🥰 creativecourselab.com & Link in bio!
.
.
.
#creativecourselab #coursecreator #coursecreation #onlineclass #teachonline #coursecreators #peggydean #topteacher

Sometimes the biggest risk is not taking one at all. So next time (aka now), ask yourself what could go RIGHT ⚡️ What opportunities might arise? What doors could be opened?
.
I had no idea I’d be where I am today. I still can’t believe the doors I’m opening daily. Failure is inevitable and generally predictable and I encourage it because it makes me learn so much.
.
This is an aimless post cuz I wanted to show up. I have some bitter feelings about social media these days. But for the small handful of you who do see this, I dare you to give yourself permission to lean into that thing you really wanna do. Something could go seriously right.
.
.
.
#handlettering #lettering #moderncalligraphy #calligraphy #crystalball #fortuneteller #whatcouldgoright #tarotillustration

Community is everything. If it wasn't for our small creative community here, I would feel aimless and might not even be doing what I do today. And you know that I LOOOVE giving back to the community in whichever way I can. This time, it's a very special one. I'm partnering with @letsmakeart on a project for an honoree of Let's Make Art Matter, Ahn.

Ahn is a mom of three who has selflessly cared for her family with a beautiful smile on her face. She has recently been going through some health issues and has been nominated by her daughter, Hanh, to be the recipient of Let's Make Art Matter. 

I'm sooo excited to invite you along to a live paintalong where we'll be working on a loose floral watercolor bouquet to send to Ahn. Just imagine her surprise and joy when she sees her mailbox filled with beautiful artwork!

The link to register for the free workshop is in my bio. 🥰

.
.
.
.
#watercolor #watercolour #watercolorillustration #watercolour_gallery #watercolourillustration #waterblog #learnwatercolor #watercolorworkshop #watercolorflowers #thepigeonletters #peggydean #letsmakeart #letsmakeartmatter

🚨 A favor please?! Real talk. I’ve been hustling for so many years, partly because my brain doesn’t seem to know when to stop, and partly because of the thrill. 

What I’m finding is that not only does this contribute to burnout, but it also affects the people who rely on me to keep it together. And I’m not just talking about my family or my team, I’m also talking about you. I realized late last year that my desire to over-deliver has, in turn, caused confusion and lack of focus—two things that I bring up often when it comes to staying mindful in creativity. 

It’s important to me to talk about this because transparency about the creative process is one of my deep-rooted values, so I want to own up and say that I’m listening and I can’t wait to slow down and reconnect with you again.

Intentionally. Purposefully. Deeply. To honor our creativity and our time. To appreciate the little things. To speak to ourselves with love. So let’s create together. This is a beautiful space. 

So that being said, I’d love to hear what you’re loving and want to learn more of, or even something you’ve been thinking about for a while but haven’t taken the leap in! 

I’m excited to cut out some noise and do some deep focus with you.

Fundamentals matter before you go breaking the rules. Learn ‘em to break ‘em. 😉 

You know where to find me! 🖊️ 
.
.
.
.
.
.
#learnlettering #letteringpractice #learncalligraphy #calligrapypractice #letteringleague #calligranewbie #handlettering #lettering #moderncalligraphy #calligraphy

7 years. This month marks 7 years of teaching art online. Somehow that feels so strange.. maybe because it has 2 syllables? I’ll say this much - Nothing I’ve worked on has ever been more joyful, more fulfilling, more connecting, more exhausting 🤣, but especially more rewarding, than establishing the community and friendships with so many of you.

From our online workshops and retreats, to seeing what you’re all creating from books I wrote (I would have never thought I’d have an actual book, but 8 already?! And ppl LIKE THEM?!), to you all loving paintbrushes and pens I’ve created (also, me 8 yrs ago doesn’t have a clue 🤯), to continue to make classes and programs that help people every day… I am HUMBLED and I am HONORED.

This year has been pivotal so far. It hasn’t been easy. It’s funny because it’s the first year in several yrs that nothing horrific has happened (knock on wood) but it’s somehow quite challenging. I’m pretty open about mistakes and growth, and so many of you have shown grace and humor, and pics of your pets, and I just feel hashtag blessed. 

So thank you for 7 years. From every millimeter in my heart. I didn’t do this alone. WE did and WE continue to pour so much into our love of creating alongside our fellow artists. 

We forget to celebrate sometimes. So LET’S ALL celebrate something today. 🥂 (👈 my glass has apple juice)

#nohashtagsneeded

Pausing. You watch your thoughts and feelings as they come into your mind as if they’re on an assembly line. You don’t react to them; you simply look at them as they come and go. This is not as easy as it sounds, but with a little effort, you can do it. 

I have continued to revisit tools surrounding mindfulness over the years because when I first began implementing them, I found art. And what a sweet gift that has been.

Sometimes it helps if you visualize your thoughts and feelings as clouds passing by. By calmly watching thoughts and getting used to the idea that you don’t have to react to them, but can just let them be, you can develop strength and resilience. You will start to find that you have the ability to change all-or-nothing beliefs and reactive behaviors that are not helpful to you. 
- excerpt from my book: Mindful Sketching. 

I poured a lot of myself into that book surrounding my own mental health. It’s been so rewarding getting to connect with so many of you on something we all feel. ♥️ 

#mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealthmatters #mindfulsketching #usk #urbansketcher #urbansketch #urbansketching #urbansketchers #sketch #sketchbook #sketching #cityscene #streetscenes

Feeling words. FEEEEELINGSSS. It only takes a moment to check in. My feelings when I filmed this earlier were different than now. Now, I feel anxious, anticipatory, and eager. I’m not kidding, being able to assign a word on what is being felt in the moment is incredibly helpful and we don’t do it enough. SO WHAT if I’m anxious? I’m calling it out so I can own that feeling. It’s temporary and I can choose how to respond to it. 

📘 Mindful Sketching 
📓 @the_happy_planner x @thepigeonletters Journal
🖊️ @zebrapen_usa Sarasa retractable 

#mindfulsketching #thehappyplanner #thepigeonletters #lgbtq #pridecollection #pride #mindfulart #bujo #journaling #mindfuljournaling

Spoiler alert: The “finish line” is when things start getting exciting. 

Lost in the sea of possibilities? Been there, done that, still there a lot of times.. 😅🤔 But let me spill some heartfelt advice:

Listen to your heart’s whispers, my friend. 🖤 Chase what sets your soul on fire. If I’ve learned nothing in the time I’ve been creating, it’s THIS. I’ve tried dabbling and even strategizing and nothing hits like my own unique interests.

Remember, progress takes work. But when we honor what we FEEL, what are gut is screaming at us, we start to watch our own magic happen! You’ve got this! 💪✨

If you want a little guidance, I created a FREE 50-page workbook on Discovering YOUR Signature Style that you can snag in my bio 🎨https://thepigeonletters.com/styleworkbook

While this is real time, there’s something misleading about this edit. Can you spot it? I’ll put the answer down further. 
.
.
.
Answer: With calligraphy and brush lettering, you want to lift your pen after each stroke. We’re drawing letters rather than writing, and lifting our pen ensures we have control over cohesive form! Hope this helps!
.
.
.
.

(This is long.. oops)  It’s funny.. how styles evolve. In this case devolve? Or how we just have spurts. Phases perhaps. Things we like to do one moment and we have no idea what’s in store for us in 6 months. Even when we think we do. As I grow, not so much in the edu-space, but as an artist, I realize how much this rings true. I’m in a simplified space right now, enjoying flat color (who even am I) geometric shapes, almost a cartoonish appeal. Don’t get me wrong, there’s a time and a place for gorgeous delicate ferns in watercolors. 

But why, as creative people, must we feel pressure to box ourselves so tightly into one technique? Into one medium? Into so few subject matters? We’re literally 
✨C🖌️R💕E🌈A🦄T⭐️I❤️‍🔥V🧜‍♀️E💎S💥
Like, it’s our title. (an aside - I took me too long to put those emojis in between those caps because I’m 37 next week so if you don’t feel like engaging on this post *subtle nod to the algorithm* at least give me emoji props) 😂 ANYWAYYYY,

My point to you is this. Imma ask a question. Are you limiting yourself? Why it why not? 

Yes, there is strategy to doing more than one thing. 💯 We talk about navigating it in The Flock (my membership for creative entrepreneurs) all the time. The most important thing to take note of is that IT’S MORE than possible.

I’m an example of how you can be successful
👉 when you have a million interests
👉 when you get bored or change your mind
👉 when you pivot after it’s “too late”
👉 when you WANT to dabble in multiple techniques/mediums/income streams/styles/etc.
👉 when you wanna show up on social media without some marketing strategy play 
👉 when you just straight up don’t want to show up on social media

Shall I go on? Raise your hand 🙋‍♀️ if you just want to feel free. Even better, share your biggest mindset traps or mindset shifts. It helps US ALL (is that an ask for engagement? I guess. whatev. 😂) I like you. You can do whatever you want. That’s my point. I’m gonna get out of the bath now. 🛁 

.
.
.
.
#procreate #thepigeonletters #peggydean #enamelpin #rainbowart #procreatebeginner #procreateart #learnprocreate

Ok so sometimes I get stuck in a ruminating thought and every time I return to it, it just feels like it doesn’t go anywhere. But as soon as I start talking it out, it starts unfolding effortlessly. 

So for me, I find that I need to give that idea space to breathe and evolve and not stay so stuck. Problem is, how do we do this without fear of judgment or even doubt… The answer is easy: it’s not a dumb idea. Period. 

In order for ideas to evolve, they have to go through some ugly steps, just like our art does. I cherish my convos with creative friends because I can spitball (spitfire?) what I’m thinking and it naturally comes together. If I let those nasty thoughts stop me from feeling free to let my mind speak, I’d never have any ideas, even “dumb” ones. 

Look at how children pick up a crayon without overthinking what color to grab, and how they tackle a blank page with an aggressive scribble. “The creative adult is the child who survived.” - Ursula K. LeGuin 

We are brilliant creatures who need not fit our genius into a trend. My idea today is different than yesterday’s, because yesterday got to breathe and come to life. We should all have that. Is there someone you feel comfortable free-flowing to/with? It’s liberating. ✨

.
.
.
.
.
#handlettering #lettering #handletteredquotes #handletteredtype #qotd #motivationalquotes #motivationmonday #thepigeonletters #peggydean

One of my favorite phrases for no particular reason is “big in Japan” and this throwback makes me happy because I can say “I’m big in Japan” 😂 but honestly what a treat.. I’m revisiting some printed work for an in depth course I’ve been working on all summer on bringing your Procreate art to printed final products of all sorts and it’s been a lot heavier of a workload than I anticipated, but we’re getting there and I can’t wait for it to finally come to fruition. I don’t usually share the details of my course projects before launch but I want to make sure I’m including everything you might want/need to know. I’m talking spreads like these, books, pins, prints, stickers, fabric, you name it. And it’s not just file formatting, it’s also practices on the types of texture and line work and how it will all translate on different items, also on manufacturer requirements for different items, and even inventory vs POD. Like… This is getting in depth. Makes me wonder if it’s worth cutting into two options for a straightforward file setup to the full Monty (that phrase isn’t as fun). Anyway, welcome to behind the scenes. Please let me know what you’re most excited about learning re: Procreate print production. You know I’m on it. 🔥 

.
.
.
.
#procreate #procreatebeginner #procreatedrawing #voguemagazine #voguejapan #peggydean #thepigeonletters #procreateillustration #licensedartist

It is wayyyy too easy to get distracted and even bored with the subject(s) we’re working on and it’s even easier to start to feel uninspired. This can happen for a number of reasons…
👎 One cause is that you have not yet found the direction for your project. 
👎 Another reason is that you may be trying to work on a project that is too big for one sitting. 
When you are working on a big project, you may need to break it down into smaller pieces. This will help you to stay focused on the project and not get bored. 
And it’s important to make sure that you are working on a project that you are care about. If you’re not passionate about your project, what’s the point?!

These little folk art taxonomies are more than I can do in one sitting but they’re dang satisfying and that makes them worth a sketchbook spread. @sketchbookbootcamp starts in just a couple days 😍

sketchbookbootcamp.com

Let’s reverse engineer this artwork (using mindfulness).

We often think life has to be this intricate. 

Mindfulness is breaking it down. Reducing the noise, the lines, the colors to their basics. 

It’s a ‘Command+Z’ or 2-finger tap for your mind. 

So, what can you simplify in your life today? 
Undo the complexity, keep the essence ✨ 

#mindfulsketching 

.
.
.
#mindfulart #mindfulness #mindfulnesspractice #peggydean #thepigeonletters #usk #urbansketcher #urbansketch #urbansketching #urbansketchers #sketch #sketchbook #sketching #cityscene #streetscenes #sasquatchbooks @sasquatchbooks

OK so it’s not about a battle of the seasons so much as it’s a battle of geography at this time of year. I finally played catch up after a very busy 6 weeks of travel, I created and launched a new class, and right as is time to come up for air, the air is 29 degrees (that’s -1.6 for my celsius friends) ❄️ 

I suppose I’ll have to bundle up and actually relax (what’s that?) 😂  Can’t complain when the biggest lingering question is… should I animate these icy raindrops with @procreate Dreams? 

If you’ve played around with it (or watched my brand new class), you’ll know what I mean when I say.. I’m thinking about using keyframes with the warp tool and perform mode to record drops in live time 😍 gosh it’s so fun to have new toys as adults 😂 

Has anyone imported existing artwork into Dreams to play yet?! 

.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Switching up “new year, new me” to “new year, new intentions” this year. My focus word: ROOTS. It’s personal for me. For me, this means returning to a place that makes me feel the most ME, a place I thrive in, a place that gives me passion, just like I did when I started my journey in art and teaching. 

It’s not just a word.. it’s my commitment to dig deeper into what I love and believe in. Let’s make it real and meaningful, you know? Do you feel pulled into a particular focus this year? Do you have a focus word? Tell me tell me!

Ok long talk 🤨 So back in the early days of Instagram (which was not actually that long ago but wow it sure does feel like it sometimes), I started learning modern calligraphy. I wanted to practice anything and everything but I was tired of the same quotes blah blah blah. I especially loved practicing people’s names. I’d practice the first name that would pop into my head starting with A and making my way to Z. And then I began joining lettering challenges. 

Surprisingly, I didn’t realize I’d get to meet so many people and loved the community around these challenges just as much as the practice itself, and I launched my #doubleletterchallenge (any OGs remember those? Maybe they should make a comeback), and found that I loved CREATING prompts even more than following along with other ones.

And then I wanted to elevate prompts in all of my artwork. 

Instead of straightforward prompts, I began integrating multiple restrictions and found that the limitations forced me to be even MORE creative. 

I limited my options for
- the subject matter
- color palette
- technique/style
- added a random *must include* item
- time limit

And just like that, my work was instantly elevated. I discovered my go-to color palette, the undertones I loved, the style I liked creating the most, and it was all because I forced myself to try new things that weren’t necessarily my ideal go-to choices. 

All that to say, I want to spread that idea to all of you and challenge you to, well, challenge yourself!

AND if you want to kick it off strong, join in on Procreate Bootcamp - we kick off on FRIDAY! Because if there’s anything I know well, it’s a good prompt 🥳 

Link in bio or procreatebootcamp.com 

I soooo hope to see you there!
